ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Playstation
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I tried AO when it first came out.  It was so laggy you really couldn t play.  I gave it 6 weeks and saw only minor improvements. But the worst part were
ygData.messageBody:
--- In EverQuest@y..., nara MKs <masterkiis_nara@y...> wrote:
> Or how about the "rumor" i heard that the first people
> to have access to the alledged EQ2 will be ONLY those
> who are on Legends? We peons will have to wait who
> knows how long...am getting burned out on all the
> politics and greed...AO is looking REALLY good about
> now
>
> Amaiya, 21st season Druid
> Fennin Ro

I tried AO when it first came out. It was so laggy you really
couldn't play. I gave it 6 weeks and saw only minor improvements.
But the worst part were the missions all got boring. Go here, kill
this, sometimes bring it back, oh sorry that mission is broken, you
get nothing.

And you think Verant customer service is bad! Read some of the AO
sites. You can find them on most of the major EQ sites. These guys
were terrible!

I'll stick with EQ. No, I haven't seen a GM event in months, but on
TT our GM's seem to be asleep at the wheel anyway. At least until
Star Wars comes out...
